intro: Verbesina boswellia, commonly known as the yellow ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy, composite flower heads. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly rough texture. Verbesina boswellia is often found in open woodlands and prairies, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
